result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order

Defendant Brittany J. Johnson in court.  Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson in court for Brittany J. Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Binger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for January 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Atty Seth Johnson

Defendant Brittany J. Johnson in court, in custody by writ RCJ.  Attorney Drew Lehman appeared for the Prosecution.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
DE is eligible for SPD services, however, no atty has agree to represent this applicant.
